page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Doddinghurst is situated at the cross of{ancient paths}once used by nomadic tribes. In Roman times a road passed in front of the site of All Saints Church and the area would have been on the edge of the network of roads which linked London and Colchester.The manor of{Doddenhenc}is recorded in the Domesday Book{for 1 hide and 17 acres {always one plough woodland 20 pigs {value 20 shillings.}And in Norman times there was a large fort at Ongar, 10 miles away. By the 13th Century there was a church and stocks and whipping post. The Priest's House is Tudor and the large houses like Brizes, Myles and Kelvedon Hall are 18th Century. There have been positive sightings of a{ghost}in the form of a stage coach driving along the coaching route from the Old Clapgate Estate.
